1.text: The words of king Lemuel; the burden wherewith his mother corrected him.

2.text: What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? And what, O son of my vows?

3.text: Give not thy strength unto women, Nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

4.text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine: Nor for princes to say: ‘Where is strong drink?’

5.text: Lest they drink, and forget that which is decreed, And pervert the justice due to any that is afflicted.

6.text: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, And wine unto the bitter in soul;

7.text: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, And remember his misery no more.

8.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, In the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

9.text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, And plead the cause of the poor and needy.

10.text: A woman of valour who can find? For her price is far above rubies.

11.text: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, And he hath no lack of gain.

12.text: She doeth him good and not evil All the days of her life.

13.text: She seeketh wool and flax, And worketh willingly with her hands.

14.text: She is like the merchant-ships; She bringeth her food from afar.

15.text: She riseth also while it is yet night, And giveth food to her household, And a portion to her maidens.

16.text: She considereth a field, and buyeth it; With the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

17.text: She girdeth her loins with strength, And maketh strong her arms.

18.text: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good; Her lamp goeth not out by night.

19.text: She layeth her hands to the distaff, And her hands hold the spindle.

20.text: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; Yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

21.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; For all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.text: She maketh for herself coverlets; Her clothing is fine linen and purple.

23.text: Her husband is known in the gates, When he sitteth among the elders of the land.

24.text: She maketh linen garments and selleth them; And delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

25.text: Strength and dignity are her clothing; And she laugheth at the time to come.

26.text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; And the law of kindness is on her tongue.

27.text: She looketh well to the ways of her household, And eateth not the bread of idleness.

28.text: Her children rise up, and call her blessed; Her husband also, and he praiseth her:

29.text: Many daughters have done valiantly, But thou excellest them all.’

30.text: Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain; But a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

31.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands; And let her works praise her in the gates.
